settings.label: Biennium funding appropriated during the time period
Multi-year appropriations that are appropriated in during the time period
Funding for the purchase of law enforcement equipment
Funding for construction of law enforcement facilities (e.g., offices, temporary detention facilities, garages, etc.)
Funding for the maintenance of law enforcement equipment and facilities

agency_metrics.description: The number of calls for police assistance received by the agency.

contexts.label: If the listed categories do not adequately describe your breakdown, please describe additional data elements included in your agency’s definition.

dimensions.description: The number of calls for police assistance received by the agency that require immediate response.

settings.label: Calls that require urgent or priority response
Calls that require code 2 or higher response
Calls that relate to incidents with imminent threats to life or danger of serious injury
Calls that relate to ongoing offenses that involve violence
Calls that relate to a serious offense that has just occurred and reason exists to believe the person suspected of committing the offense is in the area
Calls for “officer in trouble” or request for emergency assistance from an officer
Calls that relate to incidents that represent significant hazards to the flow of traffic
Calls that relate to in-progress incidents that could be classified as crimes

dimensions.label: Emergency Calls

contexts.label: If the listed categories do not adequately describe your breakdown, please describe additional data elements included in your agency’s definition.

dimensions.description: The number of calls for police assistance received by the agency that do not require immediate response.

settings.label: Calls routed to civilian community service officers for response
Calls to take a report of stolen property

dimensions.label: Non-emergency Calls

contexts.label: Please describe what data is being included in this breakdown.

dimensions.description: The number of calls for police assistance received by the agency that are not emergency or non-emergency calls.
dimensions.label: Other Calls

contexts.label: Please describe what data is being included in this breakdown.

dimensions.description: The number of calls for police assistance received by the agency of a type that is not known.
dimensions.label: Unknown Calls

settings.label: Calls for service received by the agency’s dispatch service via 911
Calls for service received by the agency’s dispatch service via 311 or equivalent non-emergency number
Mutual aid calls for support received by the agency
Officer-initiated calls for service (e.g., traffic stops, foot patrol)
Calls for service received by another jurisdiction and routed to the agency for response
Automated calls for service (e.g., security system)

dimensions.description: The number of incidents in which agency staff used physical force to gain compliance from a person.

settings.label: Strike with sufficient force to cause pain
Open hand technique with sufficient force to cause pain
Strike of person into a hard or fixed object
Using hands or equipment to stop, push back, separate, or escort without the use of sufficient force to cause pain

dimensions.label: Physical Force

contexts.label: If the listed categories do not adequately describe your breakdown, please describe additional data elements included in your agency’s definition.

dimensions.description: The number of incidents in which agency staff used a restraint to gain compliance from a person.

dimensions.label: Restraint

dimensions.description: The number of incidents in which agency staff used a firearm to gain compliance from a person.

settings.label: Pointing a firearm at a person
Displaying a firearm not aimed at a person

dimensions.label: Firearm

contexts.label: If the listed categories do not adequately describe your breakdown, please describe additional data elements included in your agency’s definition.

dimensions.description: The number of incidents in which agency staff used a non-firearm weapon to gain compliance from a person.

settings.label: Use of a noise flash diversion device
Use of a conducted electrical weapon (e.g., TASER)
Use of a less-lethal projectile weapon (e.g., PepperBall, 40mm less-lethal launcher)
Use of an impact weapon (e.g., clubs, batons, flashlights)

dimensions.description: The number of incidents in which agency staff used an unknown type of force to gain compliance from a person.
dimensions.label: Unknown Force

settings.label: Incidents involving the use of restraints
Incidents involving the use of weapons
Incidents found to be reasonable uses of force
Incidents found to be unreasonable uses of force
Incidents involving force that causes transitory pain
Incidents involving force that causes physical injury
Incidents involving force that causes great bodily harm
Incidents involved deployment of a canine
Incidents involved vehicle tactics (e.g., ramming, pursuit intervention technique)
Incidents involving de minimis force that is not intended or reasonably likely to cause any pain or injury

dimensions.description: The number of allegations of misconduct filed against agency staff relating to discrimination or racial bias that were sustained by an internal affairs unit or review board.
